sentences.english: Teachers in schools have been rubbished for the last ten years.
sentences.chinese: 過去十年學校教師一直受抨擊。

sentences.english: In his latest article he lashed into those terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 他在最近一篇文章中嚴厲抨擊了那些恐怖主義分子。

sentences.english: The loud-mouthed members in the committee fiercely criticized the management.
sentences.chinese: 委員會內愛批評別人的委員猛烈抨擊管理層。

sentences.english: And I cherish this opportunity of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 我珍惜這個被抨擊的機會。

sentences.english: The congressman launched a strong attack on the president's misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 議員猛烈抨擊了總統的胡作非爲。

sentences.english: The speaker lit into the government for its tax bill.
sentences.chinese: 演講者抨擊了政府的稅捐提案。

sentences.english: U.S. leaders took swipes at China on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 美國領導人開始抨擊中國。

sentences.english: With convincing power he portrayed the usurpation and corruptions of the papal see.
sentences.chinese: 他有力地抨擊羅馬教廷僭越權限和腐化敗壞的行爲。

sentences.english: He thundered against the policies of the Labour Government.
sentences.chinese: 他猛烈抨擊工黨政府的政策。

sentences.english: There were a few articles in the newspaper inveighing against bureaucracy.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上有幾篇抨擊官僚主義的文章。

sentences.english: This newspaper denounces the corruption of some government officials.
sentences.chinese: 這家報紙公開抨擊政府官員的腐敗行爲。

sentences.english: This kind of attack has a close contact with the problem of women liberations.
sentences.chinese: 這種抨擊是與婦女解放問題緊密聯繫在一起的。

sentences.english: The more underhanded gambit is the decision to bash the insurance industry at every turn.
sentences.chinese: 政府的另一狠招是對於保險業的大肆抨擊。

sentences.english: Ad hominem attacks are a signal of defeat in a debate.
sentences.chinese: 偏激的抨擊是則是爭辯中失敗的象徵。

sentences.english: The old poet decried the mediocrity of today's writing.
sentences.chinese: 老詩人抨擊了現代文體的平庸無奇。

sentences.english: She was Hollywood lambasting the people's choice.
sentences.chinese: 她代表好萊塢抨擊了人民的選擇。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
